answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some links that may be a helpful start to your research.
This is an article from Cal Recycle about dealing with difficult people and situations.
http://www.calrecycle.ca.gov/LEA/Training/InfoMeetings/Materials/Tool17.pdf
The Florida League of Cities has a list of resources on Civility in Government.
http://www.floridaleagueofcities.com/Resources.aspx?CNID=656
This is an article from The New Jersey State League of Municipalities called, “The Seven Golden Rules of Keeping Order at a Meeting of the Municipal Governing Body.”
http://www.njslom.org/magart_0608_pg36.html
The Institute for Local Government has a number of articles about Promoting Civility in Public Discourse.
http://www.ca-ilg.org/civility
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Judith Vicchio
text:
DOES ICMA HAVE ANY INFORMATION AVAILABLE TODAY REGARDING HOW TO HANDLE DIFFICULT PEOPLE DURING THE PUBLIC BUSINESS MEETING OF THE BOARD OF SUPERVISORS TONIGHT.  THERE IS AN ITEM ON THE AGENDA THAT CAN PRECIPITATE DIFFICULT BEHAVIOR FROM THE AUDIENCE.  THE CHAIRPERSON ASKED US TO RESEARCH THIS SUBJECT FOR TONIGHT'S MEETING.  ANYTHING YOU CAN PROVIDE WILL BE APPRECIATED.  THANKS.
